channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Drilon slams MTRCB proposal to regulate Netflix, other streaming services
item.description: "It is unfortunate that MTRCB has not been able to evolve and rise above its martial law origins... and has not been a driver of self-regulation in the industry. It should focus its efforts on being an instrument to improve the quality of content being produced, instead of being a tool for censorship," Drilon said.

item.title: Philippines logs 3,714 new COVID-19 cases; total at 232,072
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: Globally, more than 866,000 people have died of COVID-19 out of over 26.2 million people infected.

item.title: Roque told to stop commenting on Pemberton release since he's now presidential spox
item.author: Kristine Joy Patag
item.description: “The spokesperson for the president should be stopped from further making statements in this case because he is a person of power now,” lawyer Rowena Garcia-Flores, counsel of Pemberton, said.

item.title: Pemberton's lawyer seeks dismissal of Laude family appeal on court's early release order
item.author: Kristine Joy Patag
item.description: They said Laude’s legal team merely speculated whether the American serviceman showed good behavior while in prison while BuCor officers guarded Pemberton 24/7 and they “attested to the good conduct of Pemberton, based on personal knowledge.”

item.title: No environmental impact study needed on Manila 'beach nourishment' — DENR
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: (Updated 3:45 p.m.) DENR Undersecretary Benny Antiporda said the “beach nourishment” project is not covered by the country’s EIS system.

item.title: Lacson: Duterte needs strong political will, not emergency powers, to clean up PhilHealth
item.description: "More than 'emergency powers' to reorganize PhilHealth, what the President needs is real, honest-to-goodness, strong political will first," Senator Panfilo Lacson said Friday.

item.title: Palace says it won't publish appointment papers of Duterte execs
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: Malacañang has stopped releasing copies of appointment papers and is leaving it up to officials to decide whether to make their appointments public.

item.title: Group to Congress: Increase funding for education, social services in 2021 budget
item.description: "Realign the [excessive] intelligence and war funds to the health system, education, and to aid provision for grappling families and essential institutions. Infrastructure budget should go to the building of schools and medical facilities. These are where our money should go,” the Alliance of Concerned Teachers said.

item.title: Typhoon Kristine enters PAR but not seen to have direct effect on Philippines
item.description: Weather forecasters said the typhoon with international name Haishen entered PAR at 9 a.m. It was given the local name “Kristine.”

item.title: Ex-Ozamiz councilor Ardot Parojinog found dead in jail cell
item.description: Former Ozamiz City councilor Ricardo “Ardot” Parojinog was found dead in his detention cell in Ozamiz Police Station on Friday morning, the Philippine National Police said.
